html:
Cyber Security

This module introduces concepts around cyber security such as Botnet attacks, Network security, OSI model, TCP/IP, System investigation and Ethical issues, Authentication mechanism, cryptography, Digital forensics that includes both network forensics and computer forensics. You will look at how to protect systems and remove vulnerabilities, how attacks are carried out by the attackers, the ways in which vulnerabilities can be identified and exploited, and the tools and knowledge to prevent such attacks and remove any vulnerabilities.

Learning Objectives:

+  Demonstrate a critical understanding and be able to evaluate fundamental aspects of cyber security.

+  Formally identify risks to the security of data, systems and networks when presented with a given scenario.

+  Critically analyse and evaluates threats to data, systems, and networks.

+  Critically analyse the process by which disaster recovery and risk prevention plans are developed and be able to appraise such plans

Module Content:
